title: Business & Finance
text:
New York's attorney general sued Amazon, accusing it of not doing enough to protect workers in the state from the coronavirus.

---

A judge denied Citigroup's request to claw back roughly $500 million it mistakenly paid out of its own pocket to investment firms that made loans to Revlon.

---

CVS said it would re-enter the ACA insurance marketplaces next year, as the company reported quarterly results that beat estimates.

---

Goldman unveiled a low-cost digital platform that allocates and automatically rebalances individuals' wealth across portfolios.

---

The SEC sued Morningstar, alleging the firm allowed rating analysts to adjust financial models that resulted in better terms for bond issuers and in some cases less interest income for investors.

---

The Dow gained 0.2% to close at another record. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell 0.1% and 0.3%, respectively.

---

Alden Global Capital, Tribune Publishing's largest shareholder, reached a deal to acquire the rest of the newspaper company.

---

Buffett's Berkshire took stakes in Verizon and Chevron, according to a snapshot of investments held in the quarter ended Dec. 31.
